Name: White beans au vin
Steps:
Dice carrots and onions together into 1/2 inch pieces

Trim and quarter the mushrooms

In a Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the carrots
and red onion, season to taste with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring
occasionally, for 5 minutes

Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until all the
vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.

Mince garlic

Add the thyme sprigs and garlic, and cook until fragrant, about 30
seconds. Add the wine and tomato paste and cook, stirring
occasionally, until the wine is almost completely evaporated, 2 to 3
minutes

Rinse and drain beans

Add the beans, broth, Cognac, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon
pepper, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Turn the heat to
low, partly cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has
reduced and thickened, 25 to 30 minutes.

Remove and discard the thyme sprigs. Off the heat, stir in the parsley
and balsamic vinegar; season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide
among shallow bowls and sprinkle with more parsley, if desired
